intro: Daviesia trigonophylla, commonly known as the Three-leafed Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, commonly known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three oval-shaped leaflets. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense, globular inflorescences. Daviesia trigonophylla is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
